intro: Hesperidopsis eglandulosus, commonly known as the smooth-hesperidopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent leaves and deep root systems. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds in achenes. Hesperidopsis eglandulosus is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential for use in xeriscaping.
